column4: 'sup friends! so I was tinkering with GIMP yesterday, trying to update it, and I ruined my GIMP install! When i type sudo apt-get install gimp in the terminal, this message appears: " gimp-data (< 2.4.5-z) but 2.4.6-1~getdeb1 is to be installed" what should I do?
error message appears: "gimp: Depends: gimp-data (<2.4.5-z) but 2.4.6-1~getdeb1 is to be installed"
since when I click on it I can choose the "mark for installation" option, but not the uninstallation one.
you want to mark it for complete uninstall
okay it's gone. what's next please? :D
your so cute ^__^ well it's "apt-get install gimp" in the term
you may need to "sudo apt-get install gimp"
okay GIMp's back on. thanks a bunch!
lol. thanks again! see ya guys later! :D
